p.s: Description of Rugosimonospora acidiphila sp. nov.
Rugosimonospora acidiphila (a.ci.di.phi′la. N.L. neut. n. acidum acid; Gr. adj. philos loving; N.L. fem. adj. acidiphila acid-loving).
The chemotaxonomic and general characteristics are the same as given above for the genus.
Grows between 17 and 32 °C and at pH 4.5–7.2.
In addition to MK-9(H8) and MK-9(H6), also contains significant amounts of MK-9(H4).
Predominant fatty acids are cyclohexyl C17 : 0, i-C16 : 0 and ai-C17 : 0.
The G+C content of DNA of the type strain is 72.7 mol%.
The type strain, Delta1T (=DSM 45227T =NBRC 104874T), was isolated from a temperate forest soil from Gerenzano, Italy.
